attributes.action: Allow home quarantine for pets coming into the UK with Ukrainian refugees.
attributes.additional_details:
Pets who do not meet entry requirements are subject in most cases to a grueling four-month quarantine procedure wherein they are held in a rabies facility and cannot be visited by owners. In many rabies-free EU countries, home quarantine procedures are being adopted to ensure refugees are not cruelly separated from their pets. 

UK home quarantine requirements could emulate Ireland's: https://www.gov.ie/en/publication/21d40-pet-travel/#special-arrangements-for-ukraine-and-eu-citizens-in-russia
attributes.background: Despite the 'emergency support' offered, the UK has refused to waive its strict entry and quarantine policies for companion animals of Ukrainian refugees. Please introduce a home quarantine policy to allow Ukrainian refugees to enter the UK without being separated from their companion animals.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610793
